line_1: MOURN, hapless Caledonia, mourn
line_2: Thy banish'd peace, thy laurels torn!

line_1: Thy banish'd peace, thy laurels torn!
line_2: MOURN, hapless Caledonia, mourn

line_1: Thy sons, for valour long renown'd,
line_2: Lie slaughter'd on their native ground;

line_1: Lie slaughter'd on their native ground;
line_2: Thy sons, for valour long renown'd,

line_1: Thy hospitable roofs no more
line_2: Invite the stranger to the door;

line_1: Invite the stranger to the door;
line_2: Thy hospitable roofs no more

line_1: In smoaky ruins sunk they lie,
line_2: The monuments of cruelty.

line_1: The monuments of cruelty.
line_2: In smoaky ruins sunk they lie,

line_1: The wretched owner sees, afar,
line_2: His all become the prey of war;

line_1: His all become the prey of war;
line_2: The wretched owner sees, afar,

line_1: Bethinks him of his babes and wife,
line_2: Then smites his breast, and curses life.

line_1: Then smites his breast, and curses life.
line_2: Bethinks him of his babes and wife,

line_1: Thy swains are famish'd on the rocks,
line_2: Where once they fed their wanton flocks:

line_1: Where once they fed their wanton flocks:
line_2: Thy swains are famish'd on the rocks,

line_1: Thy ravish'd virgins shriek in vain;
line_2: Thy infants perish on the plain.

line_1: Thy infants perish on the plain.
line_2: Thy ravish'd virgins shriek in vain;

line_1: What boots it, then, in ev'ry clime,
line_2: Thro' the wide-spreading waste of time,

line_1: Thro' the wide-spreading waste of time,
line_2: What boots it, then, in ev'ry clime,

line_1: Thy martial glory, crown'd with praise,
line_2: Still shone with undiminish'd blaze?

line_1: Still shone with undiminish'd blaze?
line_2: Thy martial glory, crown'd with praise,

line_1: Thy tow'ring spirit now is broke,
line_2: Thy neck is bended to the yoke:

line_1: Thy neck is bended to the yoke:
line_2: Thy tow'ring spirit now is broke,

line_1: What foreign arms could never quell,
line_2: By civil rage, and rancour fell.

line_1: By civil rage, and rancour fell.
line_2: What foreign arms could never quell,

line_1: The rural pipe, and merry lay
line_2: No more shall chear the happy day:

line_1: No more shall chear the happy day:
line_2: The rural pipe, and merry lay

line_1: No social scenes of gay delight
line_2: Beguile the dreary winter night:

line_1: Beguile the dreary winter night:
line_2: No social scenes of gay delight

line_1: No strains, but those of sorrow, flow,
line_2: And nought be heard but sounds of woe,

line_1: And nought be heard but sounds of woe,
line_2: No strains, but those of sorrow, flow,

line_1: While the pale phantoms of the slain
line_2: Glide nightly o'er the silent plain.

line_1: Glide nightly o'er the silent plain.
line_2: While the pale phantoms of the slain

line_1: Oh baneful cause, oh, fatal morn,
line_2: Accurs'd to ages yet unborn!

line_1: Accurs'd to ages yet unborn!
line_2: Oh baneful cause, oh, fatal morn,

line_1: The sons against their fathers stood;
line_2: The parent shed his children's blood.

line_1: The parent shed his children's blood.
line_2: The sons against their fathers stood;

line_1: Yet, when the rage of battle ceas'd,
line_2: The victor's soul was not appeas'd:

line_1: The victor's soul was not appeas'd:
line_2: Yet, when the rage of battle ceas'd,

line_1: The naked and forlorn must feel
line_2: Devouring flames, and murd'ring steel!

line_1: Devouring flames, and murd'ring steel!
line_2: The naked and forlorn must feel

line_1: The pious mother doom'd to death,
line_2: Forsaken, wanders o'er the heath,

line_1: Forsaken, wanders o'er the heath,
line_2: The pious mother doom'd to death,

line_1: The bleak wind whistles round her head,
line_2: Her helpless orphans cry for bread.

line_1: Her helpless orphans cry for bread.
line_2: The bleak wind whistles round her head,

line_1: Bereft of shelter, food, and friend,
line_2: She views the shades of night descend,

line_1: She views the shades of night descend,
line_2: Bereft of shelter, food, and friend,

line_1: And, stretch'd beneath th' inclement skies,
line_2: Weeps o'er her tender babes, and dies.

line_1: Weeps o'er her tender babes, and dies.
line_2: And, stretch'd beneath th' inclement skies,

line_1: Whilst the warm blood bedews my veins,
line_2: And unimpair'd remembrance reigns;

line_1: And unimpair'd remembrance reigns;
line_2: Whilst the warm blood bedews my veins,

line_1: Resentment of my country's fate
line_2: Within my filial breast shall beat;

line_1: Within my filial breast shall beat;
line_2: Resentment of my country's fate

line_1: And, spite of her insulting foe,
line_2: My sympathizing verse shall flow,

line_1: My sympathizing verse shall flow,
line_2: And, spite of her insulting foe,

line_1: SOFT Sleep, profoundly pleasing power,
line_2: Sweet patron of the peaceful hour,

line_1: Sweet patron of the peaceful hour,

line_1: O listen from thy calm abode,
line_2: And hither wave thy magic rod;

line_1: And hither wave thy magic rod;
line_2: O listen from thy calm abode,

line_1: Extend thy silent, soothing sway,
line_2: And charm the canker Care away.

line_1: And charm the canker Care away.

line_1: Whether thou lov'st to glide along,
line_2: Attended by an airy throng

line_1: Attended by an airy throng

line_1: Of gentle dreams and smiles of joy,
line_2: Such as adorn the wanton boy;

line_2: Delights that better suit a king;
